Next-gen nuclear is coming, if we want it | Grist, worth a read particularly as we (Ireland) have banned nukes, and are about to ban fossil. What will we use for base load when we can't get planning for pumped storage? Debate needed. @SEAI_ie https://t.co/HGI2LpT3H4

Trend towards wider, higher, heavier vehicles has got to change. Come on @Paschald @campaignforleo @DenisNaughten Time to migrate road tax to a kg and km charge, vs fuel excise tax: Otherwise you impoverish exchequer, as suppliers game tests and impoverish consumers (Voters) https://t.co/YlcbaWQjDs

Now there's a sustainable business! Since 1785 and still growing. Ireland Inc needs to recognise successful business models, premium beef is one, volume beef is not @IFAmedia Trade on your strengths, we cannot compete on volume. https://t.co/mSV7u4maIS

"You ain't see nothin'yet" my first ad soundtrack (c1981) hand edited with 1/4inch tape for Bord Failte! So appropriate to our 2018 summer. @SEAI_ie @MetEireann @campaignforleo @Paschald @DenisNaughten @SuzieCoog Time for a new ad campaign to link this week to climate change? https://t.co/emuhYp3ruR

@downgerd Been there. Look @GoCarIreland hourly rental. Mobility as a Service (MaaS) offers one solution to Irish households' transport costs (founded in Cork too). Shared taxis are THE way to democratise access to transport and public services. To save fuel see; https://t.co/tIt9ZpiqnW
You said it. Time to tax road use per km and kg. https://t.co/c3bJAcsgfW

@downgerd To be specific, I've found it hard to find a family practical EV. Diesel still the cost effective option. In my experience, family's can make simple changes to reduce largest household cost (CSO) using existing cars, see https://t.co/FcW9OsXbrG wanna try it?

@downgerd Buy second hand, like 50% of buyers and myself. Current EVs won't suit everyone, usually a second car choice. So yes, not for everyone yet, 2025 for like for like choice. But lets get SUVs off the road in the meantime. NB 70% savings on 'fuel' gotta help, certainly did for me.

Welcome to the future: autonomous vehicles will increase congestion. @Paschald @DenisNaughten @campaignforleo Price road use per km and kg now! Even a pittance will send a strong message, remember the plastic bag tax success @MichealMartinTD https://t.co/iiDXdXIITg
